title: Fear & Loathing at Rolling Stone by Hunter S.Thompson
description:
The definitive collection of the king of gonzo journalismÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s finest work for Rolling Stone Ã¢â‚¬Å“Buy the ticket, take the ride,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ was a favorite slogan of Hunter S. Thompson, and it pretty much defined both his work and his life. Fear and Loathing at Rolling Stone showcases the roller-coaster of a career at the magazine that was his literary home.

Jann S. Wenner, the outlaw journalistÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s friend and editor for nearly thirty-five years, has assembled articles that begin with ThompsonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s infamous run for sheriff of Aspen on the Freak Party ticket in 1970 and end with his final piece on the Bush-Kerry showdown of 2004. 

In between is ThompsonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s remarkable coverage of the 1972 presidential campaignÃ¢â‚¬â€a miracle of journalism under pressureÃ¢â‚¬â€and plenty of attention paid to Richard Nixon, his bÃƒÂªte noire; encounters with Muhammad Ali, Bill Clinton, and the Super Bowl; and a lengthy excerpt from his acknowledged masterpiece, Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas.

Woven throughout is selected correspondence between Wenner and Thompson, most of it never before published. It traces the evolution of a personal and professional relationship that helped redefine modern American journalism, and also presents Thompson through a new prism as he pursued his lifelong obsession: The life and death of the American Dream.

Genre: Non-fiction | Biography
